document_data.name: Zabou Mushroom
document_data.mainbody:
'''Zabou mushrooms''' were a species of [[fungus]] that produced [[Poison|toxic]] spores, often found in [[Chult]].{{Template:Cite game/Tales from Candlekeep: Tomb of Annihilation}}

{{Quote|You should be wary, for these mushrooms can be deadly.|[[Eku]], jungle guide}}
document_data.Description: Zabou mushrooms were notorious for releasing poisonous spores when disturbed. Skilled gatherers knew how to handle the fungi, gathering them without triggering the spore release. If agitated, the mushrooms exploded with toxic spores in a radius of {{SI|10'|'"|long=yes}}. Creatures that inhaled the spores suffered the poison's effects for up to one minute. As a side-effect, the spores caused itching when they contacted bare skin.

Ecology.Uses:
If gathered with caution, zabou mushrooms could be used as projectile weapons. If hurled at one's enemy, the mushroom exploded with the poisonous spore cloud, akin to a ''[[thunderstone]]'' or a container of ''[[smokepowder]]''.

A carefully harvested specimen was valued at 10 [[gold piece]]s.

document_data.History: In the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], the [[merchant princes (Port Nyanzaru)|merchant prince]] [[Jessamine]] of [[Port Nyanzaru]] was known to send [[adventurer]]s into the jungles of Chult to gather zabou mushroom samples for her.
